TopicTitle: I can't believe new In-Game Performance.

Articles.Content:
It's now absolutely godlike. Zero Lag on Mac. I think We have to celebrate Squad about new parts, new performance, new game. Just thanks!

Edit: SQUAD ROCKS!!

Edited April 6, 2014 by TYRT

Compared to when I started back in .19, This game runs like butter..

So smooth, Such framerate.

Wow.

Can't wait till 64 bit and Multi-core support.
I'm actually getting good frame on my laptop. Can't wait to try it out on my new computer once I'm done building it.
It is pretty amazing

I agree, love the update, love the parts and the new stability so thank you squad!

I have nothing to complain about at all, its amazing.

Sure I could launch massive payloads before with loads of (lets face it) over engineering, the new parts mean it's just easier and overall a better experiance as a game.

I love it
The performance is much better! Loading is also faster.
I haven't tested this version to its limits yet but compared to when I got the game in 0.17 it runs amazingly!

The performance is much better! Loading is also faster.

Strange. My performace got better but I noticed a slight descrease in loading speed.
I can actually look at Kerbin now! Amazing.
I'm noticing that it's slightly smoother with 600+ part ships. However water-lag has not been changed for me at all.
For me it has got worse, max 25 FPS with 50 part ship at geostationary orbit...

For the most part I am getting very nice FPS, I mean, I cant believe the smoothness on some bigger launches.

However, I am getting significant frame drops when attaching multiple claws to one ship. As soon as I remove all claws my frame rate is back to being sickly-smooth.

For me it has got worse, max 25 FPS with 50 part ship at geostationary orbit...

Sphere, there must be something going horibly wrong on your end then

Maybe you should consult someone of the Q/A-Team

Sphere, there must be something going horibly wrong on your end then

Maybe you should consult someone of the Q/A-Team

I believe it may have been because I had bandicam running but not recording, but even with it closed it rarely went over 35.
Mine is running smooth, no lag.
The performance increase is very welcome, especially on my modest machine. I can now look at water and not have it become a slideshow. Thanks, Squad!

The whole game is running more smoothly for me - save larger part number ships, which are worse? That I admit confuses me. I used to run 1000+ part ships and only see a little lag. Now I get worse lag at 700 parts.

Anyone else seeing this? I've never had any issues with graphics-driven lag; mine is all physics based.
Imagine when multi-core is supported. Then your smooth as butter up to like.. 500 parts?
I know! I am able to run 500+ parts with very little FPS drops. THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU SQUAD!!!!!!!
Im getting higher FPS. I can actually look over the horizon and get no lag.

Met is now green most of the time, whereas it only was before if I avoided looking at the ground below 160km or whatever.

I have no idea of my actual FPS though - is there a way to see that within KSP?

For the most part I am getting very nice FPS, I mean, I cant believe the smoothness on some bigger launches.

However, I am getting significant frame drops when attaching multiple claws to one ship. As soon as I remove all claws my frame rate is back to being sickly-smooth.

Yeah, the same thing's happing to me. I attach three or four claws to one ship in the VAB, and I notice a huge framerate drop. As soon as I remove them, though, the framerate goes back up to normal smooth-ie-ness.
Still not green counter, but at least it is very playable now
On Mac, they've also fixed the click-on-crewhatch issue, which is absolutely great.

I use the ECLSS life support mod and there used to be this REALLY annoying bug when using it... It wouldn't let you kill or retrieve landed ships in the Tracking Station... but now... WORKS PERFECTLY.

So thanks Squad... 23.5 is heaven.
